title: Prohibits self-certification of building plans by engineers and architects where there are vertical enlargements of buildings

       Introduced  by  Sen.  KRUGER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Cities

       AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the  city  of  New  York,  in
         relation  to prohibiting self-certification of building plans by engi-
         neers and architects where there are vertical enlargements  of  build-
         ings

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The administrative code of the city of New York is  amended
    2  by adding a new section 28-103.23 to read as follows:
    3    S 28-103.23 EXAMINATION OF APPLICATION AND PLANS. ALL APPLICATIONS FOR
    4  APPROVAL  OF  PLANS AND ALL PLANS SUBMITTED IN CONNECTION THEREWITH, AND
    5  ANY AMENDMENTS THERETO, SHALL BE NUMBERED, DOCKETED AND EXAMINED PROMPT-
    6  LY AFTER THEIR SUBMISSION. THE  EXAMINATION  SHALL  BE  MADE  UNDER  THE
    7  DIRECTION OF THE COMMISSIONER FOR COMPLIANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THIS
    8  CODE  AND OTHER APPLICABLE LAWS AND REGULATIONS. THE COMMISSIONER MAY AT
    9  HIS OR HER DISCRETION, WHEN THE APPLICATION IS SUBMITTED BY AN ARCHITECT
   10  OR AN ENGINEER, DESIGNATE PORTIONS OF THE EXAMINATION FOR LIMITED SUPER-
   11  VISORY CHECK, EXCEPT IN THE  EXAMINATION  OF  PLANS  INVOLVING  VERTICAL
   12  ENLARGEMENTS OF BUILDINGS, INCLUDING THOSE VERTICAL ENLARGEMENTS CONSID-
   13  ERED  TO  BE  BUILDINGS  SEPARATE  FROM  THE  EXISTING CONSTRUCTION. THE
   14  PERSONNEL EMPLOYED FOR EXAMINATION OF PLANS SHALL BE QUALIFIED ENGINEERS
   15  OR ARCHITECTS EXPERIENCED IN BUILDING CONSTRUCTION AND DESIGN.
   16    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2090

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to
prohibiting self-certification of building plans by engineers and
architects where there are vertical enlargements of buildings

PURPOSE OR GENERAL IDEA OF BILL:
This bill would prohibit the practice of self-certification of
building plans in construction projects involving vertical
enlargements of buildings.

SUMMARY OF SPECIFIC PROVISIONS:
Section 1 amends the administrative code of the city of New York by
prohibiting the commissioner of the department of buildings from
allowing limited supervisory check of building plan examinations in
the case of plans involving vertical enlargements of buildings,
including those vertical enlargements considered to be buildings
separate from the existing construction.

Section 2 sets forth an immediate effective date.

JUSTIFICATION:
Beginning in the 1990s, New York City has allowed architects and
engineers to certify that their plans comply with the city's building
codes and zoning rules, without oversight from plan examiners from
the Department of Buildings. While this practice expedites the
construction process, it has raised serious public safety issues,
particularly with the rash of new construction going up in New York
City. with undeveloped land at an unmatched scarcity in the city, and
nearly non-existent in Manhattan, developers are rapidly erecting
vertical enlargements on existing low-rise buildings. In many of
these cases, the existing buildings are old and may be structurally
compromised. More often than not, these buildings are also inhabited,
with construction being planned above the heads of residents,
significantly increasing the potential for harm. This legislation
would ensure that a DOB professional examines plans involving
vertical enlargements of buildings, by eliminating the practice of
self-certification in these instances.

PRIOR LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
New bill.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
Undetermined.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
